Sentencas: Cr poisoning of the SUS interconnect and the solid oxide fuel cell electrode is one of the crucial hurdles to achieving system sustainability.
Titulo: Enhanced Cr tolerance of perovskite oxide via Gd0.1Ce0.9O2surface modifications

Sentencas: Among various approaches to solving this issue, the suppression of cation segregation, especially Sr, and preventing the electrode surface from direct exposure to Cr-gas have been considered the most important factors.
Titulo: Enhanced Cr tolerance of perovskite oxide via Gd0.1Ce0.9O2surface modifications

Sentencas: Herein, the effect of surface coating on mitigating Sr segregation as well as the use of strategies for protecting the electrode surface from exposure to Cr gas are discussed.
Titulo: Enhanced Cr tolerance of perovskite oxide via Gd0.1Ce0.9O2surface modifications

Sentencas: Using Sm0.5Sr0.5CoO3(SSC) as a model film electrode and Gd0.1Ce0.9O2(GDC) as the coating layer via a pulsed laser deposition (PLD) method, the Cr tolerance of the perovskite oxide electrode was enhanced.
Titulo: Enhanced Cr tolerance of perovskite oxide via Gd0.1Ce0.9O2surface modifications

Sentencas: Electrochemical measurement at 650 degrees C for 200 h showed similar to 2.5 times higher stability of the GDC-coated SSC electrode than the bare SSC electrode.
Titulo: Enhanced Cr tolerance of perovskite oxide via Gd0.1Ce0.9O2surface modifications

Sentencas: Using Auger electron spectroscopy (AES), the chemical states of the GDC-coated SSC electrode were characterized, revealing significantly reduced Sr and Cr intensity on the surface of the coated electrode when compared to the bare SSC electrode.
Titulo: Enhanced Cr tolerance of perovskite oxide via Gd0.1Ce0.9O2surface modifications
